troll noun [C]
(COMPUTING)
someone who leaves an intentionally annoying or offensive message on the internet, in order to upset someone or to get attention or cause trouble
a message that someone leaves on the internet that is intended to annoy people: A well-constructed troll will provoke irate or confused responses from flamers and newbies.

troll verb [I or T]
(FISH)
to try to catch fish by pulling a baited line through the water behind a boat: Boats were trolling for mackerel. They were trolling the colder waters of the Channel.

troll verb [I or T]
(ANNOY)
informal to leave an insulting or offensive message on the internet in order to upset someone, or to get attention or cause trouble: He's already getting trolled on social media for his comments after the game.
informal to intentionally do or say something annoying or offensive in order to upset someone, or to get attention or cause trouble: Serving food this bad is just trolling. Are you trolling me?
